document.docAuthor: Rheims, Cristina A. & Brescovit, Antonio D.
document.docTitle: Scytodes maquine Rheims & Brescovit, 2009, new species
document.masterDocTitle: New additions to the Brazilian fauna of the genus Scytodes Latreille (Araneae: Scytodidae) with emphasis on the Atlantic Forest species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New additions to the Brazilian fauna of the genus Scytodes Latreille (Araneae: Scytodidae) with emphasis on the Atlantic Forest species

figureCitation.captionText: FIGURES 130 – 140. 130 – 135. Scytodes tabuleiro n. sp. 130. Male habitus, dorsal. 131 – 133. Left male palp (131 prolateral, 132 retrolateral, 133 detail of distal region, dorsal). 134 – 135. Female epigynum (134 ventral, 135 dorsal). 136 – 140. Scytodes maquine n. sp. 136. Male habitus, dorsal. 137 – 138. Left male palp (137 prolateral, 138 retrolateral). 139 – 140. Female epigynum (139 ventral, 140 dorsal) (SP = sclerotized process). Scale lines: 0.5 mm.

male from Estação Experimental FEPAGRO, Maquiné [

;
50 ° 10 ' W

18–27 January 2002
, Equipe Biota, deposited in IBSP 91920 .

29 ° 40 ' S
;
50 ° 10 ' W

, A B. Bonaldo (
MCN 23032
).
Etymology . The specific name is a noun in apposition that refers to the type locality of the holotype .

Diagnosis . Males of
S. maquine
n.sp. resemble those of
S. fusca Walckenaer
by the palp with very simple bulb, distally narrowed and with no projections (
Figs. 137–138
;
Brescovit & Rheims 2000
: 322 , figs. 9–10 ). They are distinguished by the distal region slightly widened anteriorly and abruptly narrowed posteriorly (
Figs. 137–138
). The females are distinguished from those of the remaining Neotropical
Scytodes
by the large, irregular spermathecae, adjacent to small, slightly oval hyaline pockets (
Fig. 140
).

Description . Male ( Holotype , IBSP 91920 ). Carapace yellow with brown pattern as shown on
Fig. 136
. Chelicerae yellow with dorsal longitudinal brown stripe. Pedipalps yellow. Labium yellow, brown at base. Endites pale yellow. Sternum cream coloured with brown markings in front of each coxae. Legs yellow, except patella I brown. Femora I-IV with pair of ventral longitudinal brown stripes. Tibiae I-II with brown extremities. Tibiae and metatarsi I-IV with dorsal brown stripe. Abdomen gray with black pattern (
Fig. 136
).
Variation . Ten males: total length 3.3–4.6 ; carapace 1.8–2.2 ; femur I 3.6–5.1 ; bulb 0.44–0.68 . Ten females: total length 4.1–5.2 ; carapace 1.9–2.7 ; femur I 2.3–3.9 .
Distribution . Atlantic Forest. States of Paraná, Santa Catarina and Rio Grande do Sul.
